caseProcess.description: The case was initiated based on a complaint filed by BrandSafe Inc. alleging the sale of counterfeit goods at G. Torres' retail store.
Authorities conducted a raid on the retail store owned by G. Torres and took initial detention measures considering the large quantity of counterfeit goods found.
G. Torres was taken into criminal detention at the Vandalia Detention Center following preliminary questioning.
The procuratorate approved the formal arrest of G. Torres after gathering sufficient evidence establishing probable guilt in the selling of counterfeit goods.

criminalFacts.crimeName: Crime of Selling Counterfeit Registered Trademark Goods

details.behavior: G. Torres sold counterfeit handbags resembling popular high-end brands such as Gucci, Louis Vuitton, and Chanel from her retail store.
details.evidence: Confiscated counterfeit goods, detailed inventory lists, transaction receipts, and testimony from undercover customers.

details.behavior: Promoted a 'Best Deal Sale' event, explicitly advertising the counterfeit goods as genuine products at a significant discount.
details.evidence: Advertising flyers, social media posts on the store's official page, and CCTV footage of the sale event.

details.behavior: Sold multiple counterfeit items to an undercover officer posing as a customer.
details.evidence: Undercover purchase records, witness statement of the undercover officer, and video recording of the transaction.

details.timePeriod: Various dates from November 2022 to January 2023
details.behavior: Continued replenishment of counterfeit inventory from unverified suppliers, knowingly distributing these products as originals.
details.evidence: Supplier communications, shipping records from the suppliers, and expert analysis confirming the counterfeit nature of the goods.

judgmentResult.crimeName: Crime of Selling Counterfeit Registered Trademark Goods
judgmentResult.sentence: Three years of fixed-term imprisonment, with a suspension for five years, and a fine of $30,000.
judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: The sentence took into account the defendant's cooperation during the investigation, her first-time offense, and her agreement to close the store permanently.
